description: Verify llm.txt file exists in project root and is readable
steps: Step 1: Check if llm.txt exists in project root
Step 2: Verify file is readable as text
Step 3: Confirm file size is greater than 0 bytes

description: Verify llm.txt follows llms.txt standard markdown format with proper heading structure
steps: Step 1: Read llm.txt file
Step 2: Verify H1 heading exists (# Project Name)
Step 3: Verify H2 section headings exist (## Section Names)
Step 4: Verify markdown link format is used ([text](url))
Step 5: Verify file has valid markdown syntax with no formatting errors

description: Verify llm.txt contains key project resources and accurate links
steps: Step 1: Read llm.txt content
Step 2: Verify README.md is referenced
Step 3: Verify coding-agent.md is referenced
Step 4: Verify parallel-impl.sh is referenced
Step 5: Verify prompts directory is referenced
Step 6: Check that all linked files/paths exist in the project

description: Verify llm.txt content is clear, concise, and helpful for understanding the project
steps: Step 1: Read llm.txt file
Step 2: Verify the H1 heading clearly identifies the project
Step 3: Verify project purpose is briefly summarized (blockquote or intro section)
Step 4: Check that descriptions are concise and avoid jargon
Step 5: Verify content would help an LLM understand the project's purpose and structure
Step 6: Ensure formatting is professional and well-organized

description: Verify llm.txt includes resource organization sections and proper structure
steps: Step 1: Read llm.txt file
Step 2: Verify resources are organized into logical sections (e.g., Getting Started, Core Documentation, etc.)
Step 3: Verify each section has an H2 heading
Step 4: Verify sections contain relevant links and descriptions
Step 5: Confirm organization makes sense for an LLM to navigate the project
